snippet: Advisers to President Obama now project that the economy will create two million jobs this year, reducing the unemployment rate to about 8 percent by year's end.
abstract: Advisers to President Obama now project that the economy will create two million jobs this year, reducing the unemployment rate to about 8 percent by year's end.
lead_paragraph: Drawing on a string of improved economic data, advisers to President Obama have updated their forecasts in recent days and now project that the economy will create two million jobs this year, reducing the unemployment rate to about 8 percent by year's end. Read more »

headline.main: New White House Forecast on Jobless
